intro: Otopappus koelzii, commonly known as the Koelz's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Otopappus koelzii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
